plan_overview: This learning plan guides you through foundational and advanced topics in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) by exploring human behavior modeling, human-machine cooperation, and AI integration in interactive systems. Starting with human behavioral models and variability in interaction, you will progress to multimodal human-robot handover data and social navigation challenges. The plan then covers human-AI bidirectional learning, human-centered AI alignment, and representation learning optimized for human decision-making. Finally, it addresses human-object interaction detection and synthesis of human action-reaction to deepen your understanding of dynamic human interactions in HCI contexts.

reading_order.why_first: Introduces a behavioral model of human stubbornness in human-machine trajectory planning, foundational for understanding human behavior in interaction.
key_questions: How is human stubbornness quantified and modeled?
How does the model affect cooperative trajectory planning?
What are the implications for adaptive automation?
reading_order.paper_title: Reacting on human stubbornness in human-machine trajectory planning

reading_order.why_first: Builds on human behavior modeling by incorporating human motor variability into optimal control, enhancing human-centered automation design.
key_questions: What is human natural motor variability?
How does respecting variability improve interaction experience?
How is the variability-respecting controller designed?
reading_order.paper_title:
Study on Human-Variability-Respecting Optimal Control Affecting Human
  Interaction Experience

reading_order.why_first: Provides empirical multimodal data on human-human handovers, essential for designing natural and effective human-robot handovers.
key_questions: What features characterize human handovers?
How do object weight and visual input affect handovers?
What design implications arise for robot handovers?
reading_order.paper_title:
A Multimodal Data Set of Human Handovers with Design Implications for
  Human-Robot Handovers

reading_order.why_first: Addresses social navigation challenges by detecting invisible humans, expanding understanding of human-aware robot navigation.
key_questions: What are invisible humans in navigation?
How does anticipation improve robot path planning?
How can this approach enhance social robot behavior?
reading_order.paper_title:
Watch out! There may be a Human. Addressing Invisible Humans in Social
  Navigation

reading_order.why_first: Explores bidirectional human-AI learning in real-time tasks, illustrating interactive dynamics between humans and AI agents.
key_questions: How does AI assistance affect human performance?
How do humans influence AI learning?
What are the mechanisms of bidirectional learning?
reading_order.paper_title: Bidirectional Human-AI Learning in Real-Time Disoriented Balancing

reading_order.why_first: Frames AI alignment as a human-centered computing problem, linking HCI principles with AI system design.
key_questions: What is the relationship between AI alignment and HCC?
How can HCC principles improve AI alignment?
What are the challenges in human-centered AI design?
reading_order.paper_title:
HCC Is All You Need: Alignment-The Sensible Kind Anyway-Is Just
  Human-Centered Computing

reading_order.why_first: Presents a framework for learning human-facing representations to support human decision-making, emphasizing human-in-the-loop training.
key_questions: How does representation learning support humans?
What is the Mind Composed with Machine framework?
How is human decision-making modeled in training?
reading_order.paper_title: Learning Representations by Humans, for Humans

reading_order.why_first: Introduces human action-reaction synthesis for dynamic human-human interactions, important for realistic interaction modeling.
key_questions: What defines asymmetric human-human interactions?
How is action-reaction synthesis performed?
What datasets and benchmarks are used?

reading_order.why_first: Focuses on disentangling human-object features for detecting human-object interactions, critical for understanding interaction context.
key_questions: How are human and object features disentangled?
Why are human features more contributive?
How does the model improve HOI detection?
reading_order.paper_title: HODN: Disentangling Human-Object Feature for HOI Detection

reading_order.why_first: Concludes with a conceptual framework for human-machine relationships in NLP, broadening the scope of HCI to language-based interactions.
key_questions: What are the four types of human-machine interactions?
How do user and labor perspectives differ?
What implications does this have for NLP system design?
reading_order.paper_title:
User or Labor: An Interaction Framework for Human-Machine Relationships
  in NLP

actions.label: Model Human Stubbornness
actions.how_to: Implement the stubbornness behavioral model from paper 2407.17275 in a simulated human-machine trajectory planning scenario.
actions.expected_outcome: You can quantitatively estimate human stubbornness and adapt automation accordingly.

actions.label: Design Variability-Respecting Controller
actions.how_to: Develop and simulate the human-variability-respecting optimal controller from paper 2408.08620 using real human motor data.
actions.expected_outcome: You understand how respecting human variability improves interaction experience.

actions.label: Analyze Human Handovers Dataset
actions.how_to: Explore the multimodal handover dataset from paper 2304.02154, focusing on motion and force features under different conditions.
actions.expected_outcome: You gain insights into natural handover dynamics and design implications for robots.

actions.label: Implement Invisible Human Detection
actions.how_to: Create a detection module for invisible humans in robot navigation based on paper 2211.12216 and test path adaptation strategies.
actions.expected_outcome: You can anticipate human emergence and improve social navigation safety.

actions.label: Simulate Bidirectional Human-AI Learning
actions.how_to: Build a simplified real-time balancing task with AI assistance as described in paper 2412.05802 to observe mutual learning effects.
actions.expected_outcome: You experience how AI and humans influence each other's performance.

actions.label: Explore Human-Centered AI Alignment
actions.how_to: Critically review and summarize key points from paper 2405.03699 on framing AI alignment as human-centered computing.
actions.expected_outcome: You understand the conceptual link between HCI and AI alignment challenges.

actions.label: Train Human-Facing Representations
actions.how_to: Implement a human-in-the-loop training procedure inspired by paper 1905.12686 to optimize representations for human decision-making.
actions.expected_outcome: You can improve machine support for human decisions beyond accuracy.

actions.label: Generate Human Action-Reaction Sequences
actions.how_to: Use the benchmark and methods from paper 2403.11882 to synthesize human reactions conditioned on actions in interaction sequences.
actions.expected_outcome: You can model dynamic human-human interactions realistically.

actions.label: Develop HOI Detection Model
actions.how_to: Implement the Human and Object Disentangling Network from paper 2308.10158 and evaluate its performance on HOI datasets.
actions.expected_outcome: You improve detection of human-object interactions by disentangling features.

actions.label: Apply Human-Machine Interaction Framework in NLP
actions.how_to: Analyze NLP systems using the interaction framework from paper 2211.01553 to identify user vs labor roles and interaction types.
actions.expected_outcome: You can design NLP systems with clearer human-machine relationship models.

metrics: Accuracy of stubbornness estimation in simulation
Improvement in human interaction experience scores
Coverage and analysis depth of handover dataset features
Reduction in collision risk via invisible human detection
Performance improvement in bidirectional human-AI tasks
Comprehensiveness of AI alignment conceptual summary
Effectiveness of human-facing representations in decision support
Quality and realism of synthesized human action-reaction sequences
Precision and recall in HOI detection model
Clarity and applicability of human-machine interaction framework in NLP

timeline_weeks.deliverable: Simulation of stubbornness model and variability-respecting controller

timeline_weeks.focus: Empirical data analysis of human handovers and social navigation
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Report on handover dataset insights and invisible human detection implementation

timeline_weeks.focus: Bidirectional human-AI learning and AI alignment concepts
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Simulation of balancing task and conceptual summary document

timeline_weeks.focus: Human-facing representation learning and human action-reaction synthesis
timeline_weeks.deliverable: Prototype of human-in-the-loop training and action-reaction synthesis results

timeline_weeks.focus: Human-object interaction detection and NLP human-machine interaction framework
timeline_weeks.deliverable: HOI detection model implementation and NLP framework analysis

risks.risk: Limited practical implementation details in some papers may hinder reproducibility.
risks.mitigation: Focus on conceptual understanding and simulation where possible; supplement with related open-source tools.

risks.risk: Complexity of human behavior modeling may require advanced domain knowledge.
risks.mitigation: Start with simplified models and progressively incorporate complexity; seek expert guidance if needed.

_topics_suggestion: The selected papers may also cover research areas including: 3D Scene Understanding, Applied Machine Learning, General Algorithms, Language Modeling, Natural Language Processing, Object Detection & Pose Estimation, Reinforcement Learning, Robotics & Control. You may gain a broader understand of the field by exploring these related research directions
